Package com.gemalto.idp.mobile.securestorage

Interface PropertyStorage

public interface PropertyStorage

PropertyStorage represents a storage which can be used to store data in the form of key-value pair. It provides protections on the stored property. PropertyStorage seals the property with a password which is managed by the PasswordManager, as well as the configured device fingerprint.

NOTE: Since the password is managed by the password manager, login is required before using the storage. Default password is supported by Ezio SDK but it is strongly recommended to use a customized password for the SecureStorage.

Since:
4.0

  • Method Details

    • open

      void open() throws PasswordManagerException, DeviceFingerprintException, IdpSecureStorageException
      Open the storage. This has to be called before retrieving or updating the property in the storage.
      Throws:
      PasswordManagerException - thrown when user has not logged in for SecureStorage domain.
      DeviceFingerprintException - thrown when there is an failure in reading or verifying device fingerprint.
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • isOpen

      boolean isOpen() throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Check if the storage is open.
      Returns:
      true if storage is open.
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • getAllKeys

      Set<byte[]> getAllKeys() throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Get the set of keys for all the properties stored in the storage.
      Returns:
      Set of existing keys
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • hasProperty

      boolean hasProperty(byte[] key) throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Check if an entry with the given key exist in the storage.
      Parameters:
      key - the identifier of a property.
      Returns:
      true if the property with given key exists.
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • writeProperty

      void writeProperty(byte[] key, SecureByteArray value, boolean wipeValue) throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Store a property into the storage. If the key already exists, it overwrites the value. Note: It is not recommended to store user PIN/password or other data which are used to provide new factor of authentication.
      Parameters:
      key - the identifier of a property.
      value - in SecureByteArray
      wipeValue - if the value is to be wiped after calling the method
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • readProperty

      SecureByteArray readProperty(byte[] key) throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Read property from the storage.
      Parameters:
      key - the identifier of a property.
      Returns:
      property value in SecureByteArray
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • deleteProperty

      void deleteProperty(byte[] key) throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Delete a property with given key.
      Parameters:
      key - the identifier of a property.
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • deleteAllProperties

      void deleteAllProperties() throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Delete all the properties from the storage. Resulted in empty storage but the storage table still exists.
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0

    • close

      void close() throws IdpSecureStorageException
      Close the storage.
      Throws:
      IdpSecureStorageException - thrown when storage operation failed.
      Since:
      4.0
